title: Dynamic Queue is awesome for what it does, but the community NEEDS soloqueue and teambuilder back.
body:
[Revised] Let me start by saying that I think removing soloqueue was a bad idea.  Thinking that Dynamic Queue could replace soloqueue was folly, and removing soloqueue was a mistake.

TL;DR - I personally don't like soloqueue.  I never liked how it felt (though new champ select makes that way better), and I never liked how the games played out.  I thought it was Mario party.  An incredible number of people think otherwise and don't like Dynamic Queue.  I totally understand that.  Riot should do good by everyone and allow both schools of thought live at the same time.  Bring soloqueue back, and keep Dynamic Queue here as well.  Neither should exist at the expense of the other.  

To take it up a notch, a proposed solution would be to have an opt-out option in the client.  Allowing people to opt-out of being placed with a 4 man would be a great compromise to the whole situation.  4 man queue times would go up, but not nearly as much as if everyone who played solo and didn't care either way went to the dedicated soloqueue instead.  Furthermore, soloqueue players that opted out would only see longer queue times relative to the number of 4 man queues that their search passes up, allowing them to still match into 2q and 3q groups (which apparently aren't nearly as much of a problem to them?), and this also means 2q and 3q groups will not see any difference in queue time which would happen if all of the singletons spun off to soloqueue instead.

Soloqueue fills a niche that doesn't gel with Dynamic Queue.  Yes, on paper, dynamic queue makes sense.  A solo + 4man vs a solo + 4man makes sense, right?  Except that what if their solo is Nasus top lane, and you queue solo jungler.  Now the enemy team's jungler is in close communication with two lanes, while Nasus does his Nasus thing and you're getting screamed at by everyone on your team.  This is not a zero sum equation.

Soloqueue needs to come back (with New Champ Select of course), because tons of people want to play the game solo vs solos.  Riot can't hide behind the defense that this is a pure teamwork game because so many champions and items and strategies exist to encourage this as a viable strategy.  1+1+1+1+1 vs 1+1+1+1+1 is completely functional and these players should be allowed to pick this instead of being pressganged into a premade.

Teambuilder also filled a niche that neither soloqueue nor New Machmaking pulls off.  The ability to just flat out ensure you get your role and your champ.  If you want to practice something specifically or you really just want to play something right now, you could find respite from the tumultuous hell that was pick/call soloqueue in here.  Furthermore, some people just don't want a damn rank hanging over them like the moon in Majora's Mask.  They just want to play Azir mid all the god damn time with no fuss.  That was the beauty that Teambuilder brought.  New Champ Select, IMO, does a well enough job, but Riot would do well to realize what Teambuilder brought to the table and why some people find New Champ Select  a flat out downgrade.

However, Dynamic Queue needs to remain as it is to allow solo entities like myself whom greatly enjoy being able to link up with premades and try to merge with their teamwork for full teamwork oriented gameplay.  Teambuilder was just soloqueue with dedicated picks, and soloqueue never came close to what I wanted.  Dynamic Queue is my god damn ambrosia.  It is my Valhalla, where I can find warriors of legend and fight alongside them for glory.  No other queue method reliably combined the ability for me to reliably play what I wanted, in a ranked format, with the potential to play with teams that actually wanted to work together as a group.

On queue times, I love the quality of the matches Dynamic Queue brings me.  I'd rather wait 30m for a good match, than two minutes for a 20m surrender shitshow on either side.

Still, Riot should at least entertain the idea of bringing soloqueue back.  There are clearly three distinct types of players (idgaf I just wanna play what I want right now, solo rankers, and group rankers that don't want to be nailed down to a ranked team).  Servicing only one of them (at the expense of the other two!) is just unfair.

replies.body:
Take my upvote for a professional, polite, and well worded assessment of the current situation of the game.

I do appreciate that you did not whine like 90% of the other posts on this topic. Well done sir! :)

Part of it comes from the fact that I'm like, the one percent of vocal players that actually seems to like DQ.

DQ has its problems, particularly for single players, but they are nothing in comparison to the hell I experienced literally every single game in soloqueue.  I had a hundred percent guarantee to have a miserable time, even winning, in soloqueue.  I know that soloqueue is not for me, but it is for a lot of other people, and if they want to play that then I don't see any reason why they should be denied.  Hell, I believe it'd be win-win.  I'm sure matching a bunch of soloqueuers would be fast so none of them would have to worry about vicious queue times, and while it may increase DQ match times I know for sure that everyone involved would be completely teamwork focused because all of the wildcard solo entities would be in their own hopper.

So I mean, please, seriously, put Soloqueue back in.  Not because blah blah whiny blah blah, but because there are seriously two extremely divergent religions when it comes to playing, and killing one to raise up the other is not the way to go.

Though, honestly, New Champ Select should have probably soaked into soloqueue for a while to see if it absolved a lot of problems without adding Dynamic Queue in, and, if there really must be a compromise, I would still sacrifice DQ for NCS-soloqueue if it meant making everyone more globally happy.
They will *never* have room for both DQ and Solo Queue. EVER. The two queues would cannibalize each other. That's the real reason why they're looking to make DQ as functional as possible.

Nah, I got that.  It has been something my friends and I have mulled over for a while.

There's just no good way for four people to play right now.  I concede the point that unless a solo player is totally mentally prepared for it (and most aren't/don't want to be/etc) then 1+4 is really nasty for them.

Problem is, people like me who constantly have 4 (but only 4) people on have no real other recourse.  There's unranked (same problem, worse skill matchups), splitting the party up, or playing aram.  All of those options suck for 4 people that just wanna do ranked.

Oh, and if someone wants to tell me "just find a fifth" then I want to ask where the hell is my eHarmony for LoL?  Until Riot _themselves_ makes an in-client or in-website ecosystem way to manage and find other people with the same insane production value they put into New Champ Select then that's not a pragmatic solution, but hey, that'd be helping fix the deep rooted problem in the first place, which just seems damn silly.  I jest.  {{champion:35}}

Honestly, the best way to find a fifth, is to keep playing as a 4-man group, and when you get matched with a random player that synergizes extra well with your team, ask if he wants to keep playing with you.

Yeah but the real ARAM problem is the script bots are starting to become more prevalent there. No one minds a four man premade in ARAM mainly cause the champs are randomized. I just hope they make it so all the champs are unlocked in there to avoid ARAM specific accounts as that takes the 'AR' out of it.

Let's be clear here:  In the comparison you bring up between Dynamic Queue and Team Builder, you are referring to **New Champion Select**, not Dynamic Queue.  Important distinction.

I don't really see the need to bring Team Builder back, to be honest, and I'm a fan of having a standardized method of selecting your champion in all queues.  I agree that being guaranteed a specific role is nice, but I don't feel it's worth an entirely separate queue just to raise your chance of getting your primary from ~60% to 100% when that isn't at all applicable for any other queue (e.g. Ranked).

In my personal opinion, Dynamic Queue is ideal for normal games whereas Solo Queue is ideal for ranked games.  It's mathematically impossible for Dynamic Queue to result in games as balanced as pure Solo Queue, this is an inarguable fact, and for a queue toted as the most competitive in League of Legends this issue seems pretty significant.  I just don't really see where Team Builder would fit in there without pulling players away from Dynamic Queue in normal games, which is likely to further increase queue times for both Team Builder **and** Dynamic Queue.

I agree.  This was mostly an attempt to discuss all of the prior models and what they did for the communities.  I'm gonna go and revise my message about DQ-NCS.

While team builder did have its place, the only real sway it had was guaranteed champ and role (and sometimes insane queue times dwarfing DQ times).

As some below point out, even with LoL's gigantic playerbase the queue times would be absurd if fragmented into all these variants, so if I had to pick a subset I would want to retain Dynamic Queue + New Champ Select  for Ranked, as well as Solo Queue + New Champ Select for Ranked as an alternate.

That said, I think blind pick is kind of awkward when all is said and done and would have been fine if that got swapped out with Team Builder permanently but that would probably cause more harm than good.  Some people just want to click go and play as fast as possible with no fuss or pageantry.

I do disagree with the idea that DQ is not the way to roll with ranked, but that's because I strongly believe the landscape of the game is dramatically different between a sea of solos/duos and a premade crew.  There was once a time I did play on a five man team in ranked teams, and I may as well have been playing two different games when I bounced between soloqueue ranked and team ranked.  The champs I found success on (and, if the same champs, even the way I played them), the difference in how I approached combat, hell even the lane setups I'd gank for when I ran jungle changed completely.  Most of those friends quit, and I vastly preferred the flow of the game in a five man premade.   I get a lot of that feel from DQ when I pair up with premades, though, and it combined with New Champ Select singlehandedly made me care again.

DQ tries to strike a balance, and I like that.  I'm sure I'm not alone when it comes to people who cannot find four other reliable players despite constantly attempting to.

TL;DR, and don't take offense to this soloqueue one man army players, but I don't want to play like that and I don't want to play alongside you guys if you are unhappy with the premade thing.  I don't want you to be unhappy either but ya'll play a much different feeling game, IMO, than I want to, so hopefully they give you soloqueue back to be able to play it again.

Replace blind pick.  Seriously it offers not benefit to the game.  Team Builder is good for folks who play 1 or 2 games a day and aren't particularly bothered about being competitive.  Heros of the storm has quick match and draft for a reason.  QM lets you pick what ever hero you want and pairs you up with little concern of composition.  Not great for competitive play but its fine for casual play.  Riot seems to have decided that casual play has no place in their game and its bummed me, my boyfriend, and my roommates from really wanting to play anymore.  Not everything is about being hyper competitive.

I'll happily agree that from a competitive or ranked standpoint the new draft is absolutely better then team builder, I disagree that it should be the only option available for the casual player besides blind pick.  Which again serves no real purpose and is just a toxic cesspool.

Please do not lump Team Builder and solo queue together as an issue.  Personally I'm glad they replaced team builder with dynamic.  It is better.  It actually improved game enjoyment.  Where as dynamic ranked degraded the solo player experience to the point where the game is decided by which side has the better more organized premade.  Winning isn't even fun as the solo player when you have no sense of having any sort of impact on the game.  Also we weren't "mislead" about the fate of team builder, unlike the future of solo queue.

I would counter with the way that I felt when playing soloqueue.

I never felt like I had any sense of impact in soloqueue no matter what I was doing.  The game felt like Mario Party to me, in there.  With screwball "coordination" and five team leaders the only real big strategies that seemed to go down were simply by virtue that when at pure chaos one can only move towards more order.  My efforts always felt muted and often voided by the randomness of all the shit going on in the map at completely random times unless I hardcarried with 20 kills in as many minutes.  To me, soloqueue felt like "things happened, a team won, and I was there."  Winning never felt good to me in soloqueue, it was merely a relief that we didn't lose.  It felt like the random unassociated shit that my team did just happened to work better at the time than the random unassociated shit that the other team did.

With DQ, I can at least reliably get the sense that people are coordinating in a team, and I enjoy linking up with that like some half baked Voltron, and that at the very least there's the illusion that everyone is moving towards things with a purpose, as a team.

I know many feel very, very, differently and prefer that environment and, by all means, Riot should listen and you should have it, but neither soloqueue nor dynamic queue should exist at the cost of the other, because some people want one, some people want the other, and neither group should force the other group to play their version of League.

Also, a small jab here and I do apologize in advance but "Where as dynamic ranked degraded the solo player experience to the point where the game is decided by which side has the better more organized premade."  I mean, I'm going to try to be as inoffensive as possible, but you are literally complaining that a team based game is being decided by the best team.  I know it feels awkward to consider, but if you help that premade out and link up, then for that game, you are their single serving addition to "their" team.  A good premade with a garbage player that feeds left and right is going to lose to a decent premade if the missing Planeteer links up.  You can carry just as hard with a premade team filling the rest of your ranks as you could with four other solos.  The only way that is taken away from you is if you put that on yourself.  There's no difference between a solo 24-0 Ahri in last year's soloqueue and a solo 24-0 Ahri in this year's dynamic queue.

I see the same argument all over the place, and ya'll are totally allowed to want soloqueue back and I think Riot should do it, but I want everyone to realize the hilarity of this argument (and realize that I have almost exclusively soloqueued into DQ this year):

Soloqueue players since launch: "I hate losing because the enemy team's randoms were better than my team's randoms."
Soloqueuers in Dynamic Queue: "I hate losing because the enemy team's premade was better than my team's."

But in terms of winning, many of you feel cheated because your contributions were somehow undercut by the mere fact that the other people are in a Skype call?  I truly don't understand why.  You helped shape that game as a win.  You showed that you were a fifth wheel that could be relied on or at least trusted to not do terribly.  You can even carry the whole thing!  They could have gotten matched up with FeederMcFeederson and lost hardcore, but instead the had you, and your team (which includes _YOU_) won the game.

Do you seriously think solo players had stronger impact on ranked games before Dynamic Queue existed?

The only difference now is communication. People in premades have more access to team strategies and communication than solo players do, but solo players still pretty don't have a control over the games other than their own performances.

I would even say that they definitely have the capacity to make more impact now.  Now solos can magnify their impact by feeding into the strategy the other four are employing.

I think a lot of the pain on the tip of everyone's tongues that nobody wants to just come out and say is that lots of solo players simply don't want to feel required to "play as a team."  In a 1+4 environment then it is very unlikely that the situation that they can win now by ignoring or playing around (read: not intentionally with) the 4-Q because the 4-Q is extremely unlikely to shift to play ball with whatever the solo was doing.

It makes sense, in a strange way.  Solos in soloqueue were almost definitely more successful doing their own thing because if everyone was then there's equal probability that other solos will link up randomly and help your thing succeed and vice versa, and there's less a chance that the enemy rallies up and stonewalls you in a coordinated effort.

I think that if everyone just chills out and stops treating it like 1+4 (which I know I am bad and perpetuating by saying it like that a lot) and just taking it as "the rest of my team is coordinated" then a lot more people will have a much better time, but if someone doesn't want that pressure and almost required team play focus then they should be allowed to play something (soloqueue redux) that alleviates all those concerns.  It is only fair.

I guess the problems stem from social anxiety and toxicity. Solo players simply don't want to coordinate with premade strangers in their own teams because they prefer solitude. I understand because they are humans after all. Not all humans are sociable, but this is a team game where they are often required to communicate strategies and encourage your teammates, which makes the whole situation ironic and paradoxical.

The other issue is toxicity, but this can be properly explained. Unsuccessful solo players often remember and speak of the times when they were berated, ignored, flamed by the premades. However, it's common sense that people only remember bad experiences in League of Legends rather than bland "good experiences". Also, toxicity was often found in Solo Queue too, so it's not just exclusive to Dynamic Queue, but the same vocal crowd seems to have selective memory.

Don't get me wrong: there definitely are existing issues in Dynamic Queue (like teams composed of 5 solo players getting matched against teams with premades, or weak players potentially getting carried by their high-elo premade partners), but like I said in [this post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/xynP3nE2-so-many-solo-queue-threads?comment=000300000000000000000000), measuring individual performances in a team game simply does not work unless Riot sets up legitimate, valid and adequate criteria for it, which Riot said they won't do. They can't anyways, as it's simply too difficult.

You're in silver fucking elo. Trust me, no one in your ranked games has any idea on how to organize their gameplay even if they're all premade (which rarely happens in your elo)

Just because you see the pros complaining about this shit doesn't mean it applies to you. The pros are in challenger and actually face these problems due to the low population making the matchmaking fucked up. In silver this isn't a problem. Most of the time 5 mans are matched against other 5 mans. Trust me, I've climbed to diamond this season playing solo. 

Dyanmic que is just another excuse kids are using to why they can't climb and it's getting pathetic

>Winning isn't even fun as the solo player when you have no sense of having any sort of impact on the game

Lmfao and before dynamic que it was "my team feeds, i can't impact the game" now it's "I can't impact the game against premades."

I think there's this weird thing where the community mixes up the new champ select with dynamic queue. The new champion select is NOT a replacement for Teambuilder, because the new champion select is DRAFT mode where you have bans and counterpicks. So if you want to, for instance, spam the new champion, or play Zed until your fingers bleed to LEARN him, you can't do that anymore. In Teambuilder, you could queue with an absolutely idiotic team comp and actually let your teammates know what you wanted to do. I love playing Soraka/Volibear bot lane. (Also Janna/Yasuo, but I digress...) In Teambuilder, I could specify I wanted an ADC top, and people would know going in they were going to have Volibear/Soraka bot. Now, I have to make it through pick-and-ban phase, or just DO it in a blind pick, which inevitably tilts everyone.

So for players under Plat who actually need to fluff out their roster of playable champions, Teambuilder was great. If you loved playing Azir mid like OP said, you could just happily play Azir mid all god damn day until the word "Shurima" triggered you. If you needed to learn a tank for the jungle or support, you could dedicate a day to learning that champion. And like OP said, nobody--and I mean NOBODY--likes blind pick, so if they could replace the current call-your-lane-as-fast-as-you-could option with old Teambuilder and 'fill' option for people who like to fill, that would be nice. (Did old Teambuilder have that? It's been so long... I've forgotten...)

Now, Dynamic Queue is not a replacement for SoloQ because of all the many reasons multiple board posts have pointed out. DynamicQ is the system where you can queue with 3, 4 or 5 people in Ranked. (I don't have any problem with DynamicQ in normals. It is obviously and clearly superior in normals, where FUN should outweigh COMPETITIVENESS.) Soloq players feel cheated because of the inherent lack of competitiveness and their disadvantage (no, queuing with other people is not a solution to this problem) in the DynamicQ system. 

tldr: PLEASE BRING BACK TEAMBUILDER

I agree that we need soloQ, but I think dynQ is a decent replacement for Team Builder. I'll just go ahead and quote myself from the other thread:

> [{quoted}](name=singurytas,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=b5IJd7cE,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2016-04-28T17:05:10.394+0000)
>
Teambuilder get's easily outclassed by DynQ normal:
> - you keep talking about the champion select time, but it seems that you totally forgot how long it took to get a Teambuilder game started
> -> if you started a lobby you better have support and adc - otherwise you are going to wait for 10 minutes until you get a support. Who will of course leave before you get an ADC - and vice versa.
> -> this is especially true if you want to pick something unusual. No way that you'll find a support and an ADC who are both happy with eg Teemo mid
> - no bans. I am not a great fan of many bans, but those that we have are definetely needed. Unless you'd really enjoy having a tank Ekko mirror matchup all the time (or horrors like 4.20 weedwick)
> - less luck dependent. In Teambuilder there is so much luck involved as you could get countered or counter the opponent without anything you could do.
> League + dice is not something that I do enjoy, not even in normals.

I like dynamic queue, but I find it frustrating at the same time. The frustrating aspect for me about it has nothing to do with Riot and its design of dynamic queue but rather the approach people take to champion select. In lower leagues (Gold-Bronze, also the majority of the player base) seem to  play whatever they want, they do not take into account their teammates picks before them or what the enemy had decided to draft before their turn.

In the old Solo Q people drafted to complete their team comp or pick a favorable matchup, now its more like organized blind pick with a handful of bans. I have had many games where my team has no way to engage or seige.

> [{quoted}](name=Cocolow,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zQEFr2bd,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-04-28T20:58:13.136+0000)
> In the old Solo Q people drafted to complete their team comp or pick a favorable matchup, now its more like organized blind pick with a handful of bans. I have had many games where my team has no way to engage or seige.

As I made this mistake in generalizing (and corrected it in my Original Post) I assume you meant NewChampSelect and not DQ?

Don't take this the wrong way, but that is a very rose-tinted way of perceiving motivation back then.  I'm extremely pessimistic and cynical, so take this with a grain of sugar (to offset the salt?  Ha?  I'll leave).

To me, more often than not back in soloqueue it was less of a desire to fill the group out because they wanted to, but because they probably didn't get to do what they wanted or were best at and just wanted to hedge the bet by playing into meta.  Support getting forced into mid lane somehow?  Well, I'm not sure what I'm doing here so lemme just consult a counterpick site and just take a hardcounter and pray.  They did whatever it took to win, because playing what they wanted to and having fun was already off the table.  This is also why, I believe, people got so mad at losing.  Far more often than not people were strongarmed into crap they didn't want to play, so all they really had was the big W.  Take that away and...  

In my eyes, in NCS, people are extremely excited that they can grab what they want, in the role they want, so it ends up going from "ugh I got stuck on top lane and we need a tank right now so I guess I'll pick one or whatever" to "holy crap I got a jungler and Nidalee wasn't banned awwww yes!"  Of course, that's just me.  I have way more fun losing a game by playing something I like in a way I like it than losing a game (and sometimes winning them!) after being held hostage by pick order and meta.  I truly think that (when the clearly OP are banned) a team of five people playing stuff they love and are experienced with are much more likely to win (or at least enjoy themselves no matter what) than they would be in soloqueue left to rot under a role they despise, and I think that NCS offers that in spades.

To me, arguing that the old system was "better" is sort of like saying it was better that people were constantly playing stuff they didn't want to because it matched with the meta and was more likely to win than it was to have everyone do what they wanted to do and enjoy doing it.

Now, for the rest of the argument with regards to soloqueue and whatnot, many seem to feel that even that doesn't offset the pain they feel at playing in DQ ranked, which is why I am totally for putting soloqueue back in.

I'd much rather wait 15m for a good match where everyone is playing what they want and the teams are evened out than a potpourri match where everyone may as well have been picked first come first serve.

Fifteen minutes of waiting?  Sure, I can do something while I wait.

2 minutes of waiting and then 3 minutes of champ select and a 20m shitshow is flat out wasting 25m of time I could have been doing something else.
I say we keep trio queue with the new champ select. Personally I think 4 mans and 5 mans are the problem.

5 mans have essentially been kept the same, just the queue looks different. They're still matched against other teams of 5 (except for VERY rare cases, and extremely high ranks).
If you take away groups of 5, without replacing it with some alternative, people don't have the avenues to have the full-team coordination that is so obvious in pro play.

> [{quoted}](name=Akeydel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zQEFr2bd,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2016-04-29T01:49:57.378+0000)
>

> If you take away groups of 5, without replacing it with some alternative, people don't have the avenues to have the full-team coordination that is so obvious in pro play.

Why not bring backed ranked 5's?

Tech funnel, probably.  It's amazing how much you can save in terms of money and engineer time just running and maintaining a single vertical tech stack.  The more they can get to work on a single system the better.  This is probably the main reason why they haven't just "flipped the switch" to kick SQ back on in the meantime while they work out a compromise.

Putting ranked 5s back in would mean re-enabling that queue and turning back on and hooking up everything etc.  I don't mind one way or another, but I'm just explaining it.

It'd be like... take those insanely thing, hell smelted lego pieces.  They used to have an 8x2 thin devil brick for ranked and slapped 5s teams and soloqueue 4x2 bricks onto it.

Then they spent a lot of time reducing all of that to a single thin 4x1 brick.

Putting ranked 5s back in (or soloqueue for that matter) would be like having them figure out how to make an overhead P shaped block that looks like a 4x2 that had one edge transition into a 4x1 extension to plug both queue modes into.

Okay, that analogy was ass.  I'm a software engineer.  Creativity is evil.  I hate pulling apart thin legos.  It worked in my head.

First, if this is the reason, they don't deserve this community. 1.4B$ in a year isn't enough to keep to queue pipelines huh?

But regardless..this DQ is terrifyingly bad tech-wise...Riot has unskilled engineers and it shows. But their Role Selection Process and the MatchMaking Process are of poor and ancient design.

Riot has the ability to revert back to the old system pretty quickly and without major hassle as evident from the fact that they already did it once during this season.

Start thinking by yourselves; read some books; go back to school/uni  and don't waste my time like this to explain basic stuff/basic logic...

That is just not true. Solo playing is and always will be faster then queuing with friends. 

Lets say you have 4 people. player one is top and mid, player 2 is mid and jungle, player 3 is jungle and adc, player 4 is adc and support. You have all 5 roles "covered". However in reality you need a solo player that picked adc and support. That solo player can find a group of any combination that needs either adc or support which is a much larger number. On top of that matchmaking will specifically try to find another premade of 4. A team of 5 has to find another team of 5 which their are the lowest amount of. On the other hand a premade of 2 can find another premade of 2 and a solo player or a premade of 3 or 3 solo players. A solo player has it even better; they can find 4 other solo players, a premade of 4, or combinations of solo players and groups of 3 and 2. Also the more members you add to a team the harder it is for matchmaking to find a equally skilled opposing group of the same size.

By the way my reasoning of queue times is basically why Riot said they are going to put a hold on solo queue.
